Sage Engine

Command & Conquer 3 was created using Electronic Art’s (EA) Sage Engine. It has been used on Command & Conquer: Generals, Command & Conquer Generals: Zero Hour, and The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle Earth I & II & The Rise of the Witch-king.

The Sage Engine utilizes 3DSMax as its main application for creating art.  There are 4 main tools that are used in 3DSMax: .W3X Exporter, w3d Skin modifier, w3d utilities and w3d materials. These are generally referred to as the W3D tools.

The W3X viewer allows the user to view the W3X files exported from max before bringing them in-game.

The Sage Engine also uses World Builder, which is a proprietary application for the creation of single-player and multiplayer maps for the game. An updated version of Worldbuilder is required for creating maps which depend on content in a Command & Conquer 3 mod, and can be downloaded at Command and Conquer.com

MODs in the Sage Engine for Command & Conquer 3 have several required applications. Click here to view them.
